Articles.Content:
So my planet isn't loading in the game. Anybody knows what's wrong about the file?

Yeah, it's just all testing. It's not a finished planet at all. Just testing what I can do with PQS textures. I've seen the tutorial of @The White Guardian. It helped, but still didn't load into the game.

file:

http://pastebin.com/rHVafCpJ

30 minutes ago, ApertureGaming said:

So my planet isn't loading in the game. Anybody knows what's wrong about the file?

Yeah, it's just all testing. It's not a finished planet at all. Just testing what I can do with PQS textures. I've seen the tutorial of @The White Guardian. It helped, but still didn't load into the game.

file:

http://pastebin.com/rHVafCpJ

Hello @ApertureGaming. First off, remove the flightGlobalsIndex, it is unnecessary and will only lead to incompatibility issues. Not specifying it means that Kopernicus will automatically give your planets a F.G.I but Kopernicus takes other planet packs into account when doing so.

Secondly, could you copy-N-paste the contents of the file 'KSPDirectory/logs/Casio.body'? It should tell me where Kopernicus is experiencing issues with loading your planet. Because I honestly don't see why your planet won't work.

HI,

Could you put a temporary ScaledSpace node in there before you ask?

My planets do not load without it. Just use a random texture and if KittopiaTech is installed use that to update ScaledSpace.

Here it is @The White Guardian. http://pastebin.com/KSqbujUY

@RA3236, kittopiatech is for version 1.0.5. I'm using 1.1. It doesn't work for 1.1!

1 hour ago, RA3236 said:

HI,

Could you put a temporary ScaledSpace node in there before you ask?

My planets do not load without it. Just use a random texture and if KittopiaTech is installed use that to update ScaledSpace.

Not necessary, if ScaledVersion isn't put in, the Template's ScaledSpace textures will be used instead.

@ApertureGaming Somehow Kopernicus skips most of the info: 

[LOG 08:52:34]: GeeASL = 0
[LOG 08:52:34]: Radius = 0
[LOG 08:52:34]: Mass = 0
[LOG 08:52:34]: Density = 0
[LOG 08:52:34]: SurfaceArea = 0
[LOG 08:52:34]: gravParameter = 0
[LOG 08:52:34]: sphereOfInfluence = Infinity
[LOG 08:52:34]: hillSphere = 0
[LOG 08:52:34]: gMagnitudeAtCenter = 0
[LOG 08:52:34]: atmDensityASL = 0

And I don't see it applying the PQSMods. This is bizarre, I've never seen anything like this. Furthermore, according to the description node in the config you specified, the description is 'test planet', but Kopernicus gives it the description " A mysterious uncharted celestial body. "

Are you certain you've uploaded the recentmost version of the config?

Edited May 3, 2016 by The White Guardian

I'm surprised even you didn't see the problem!  I closed the "Body" all the way at the beginning right after "cacheFile".. . Haha, I could have seen that a little earlier!  It's fixed now. Thanks anyways
